intro: Bulbinella setifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved rock lily, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Bulbinella setifolia is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
